com.ibm.mobile.services.location

Class IBMLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • IBMBluemixService
      • com.ibm.mobile.services.location.IBMLocation

  • public class IBMLocation
extends IBMBluemixService
    IBMLocation provides methods to perform location-based operations. The IBMLocation class is a provisional API. APIs that are marked provisional are evolving and might change or be removed in future releases.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeService

        public static IBMLocation initializeService()
        This method initializes and returns the location service. This method MUST be called prior to performing operations using this SDK.
        Returns:
        An instance of the location service

      • getService

        public static IBMLocation getService()
        Returns an instance of the location service if the service has been initialized
        Returns:
        An instance of the location service

      • getLocationServicesConfig

        public IBMLocationConfiguration getLocationServicesConfig()
        Returns:
        The current location services configuration for this device.

      • startAcquisition

        public  startAcquisition(IBMLocationConfiguration newConfiguration)

        Ongoing acquisition is started for the Geo sensors as provided in the geo acquisition policy. When new sensor information is acquired, the location context is updated, and the specified triggers are evaluated for activation.

        After calling this method, getLocationServicesConfig() will return newConfiguration

        Parameters:
        newConfiguration - the configuration to use, specifying acquisition policy, trigger configuration and failure callbacks. Changes made to it after calling this method will not modify the runtime behavior unless the object is passed again in a new call to this method.
        Returns:
        a Task of type Boolean indicating whether geo acquisition has successfully started.

      • startAcquisition

        public  startAcquisition()

        Ongoing acquisition is started for the Geo sensors using the power saving profile IBMGeoAcquisitionPolicy.getPowerSavingProfile().

        Returns:
        Task of type Boolean indicating whether geo acquisition has been successfully started.

      • acquireGeoPosition

        public  acquireGeoPosition(IBMGeoAcquisitionPolicy geoPolicy)
        Acquires a geographical position.

        The device attempts to acquire a geographical position. If the attempt is successful, the following actions take place:

        • The location context might be updated. This action is dependent on the freshness of the data in the context, and the new position data being at least as accurate as the existing position data.
        • If the location context was updated, triggers might be activated.

        Note: Because acquireGeoPosition might activate triggers, you should not call acquireGeoPosition from a trigger callback. Potentially, this could cause an endless loop of trigger evaluations leading to callbacks leading to acquireGeoPosition calls.

        Parameters:
        geoPolicy - The policy that is used to configure the acquisition.
        Returns:
        Task of type IBMPosition containing the current position data.

      • stopAcquisition

        public void stopAcquisition()
        Stops the ongoing acquisition. The stop action is delegated to all relevant sensors, and all trigger states are cleared.

      • getLocationContext

        public IBMLocationContext getLocationContext()
        Returns:
        The current location context, containing information about the acquired locations. If startAcquisition(IBMLocationConfiguration) has not been called since startup or since the latest call to stopAcquisition(), returns null.
